scenarios.title: Scenario 1 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 1 is a low-code development platform that has been around for 5 years. In the last 6 months, the Developer Relations team has noticed:
list: Decrease in participation in online events
Fewer contributions to documentation
Drop in the number of new extensions/plugins
Increase in complaints about unresolved issues
Competitors gaining more attention on social media

scenarios.title: Scenario 2 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 2 develops an open-source framework for microservices that gained popularity quickly. In 2 years, the ecosystem has grown to include:
list: More than 200 third-party plugins
Multiple versions being maintained simultaneously
Different implementations for various programming languages
Significant forks with divergent functionalities
User confusion about which version/implementation to use
Incompatibilities between plugins
Overload on the team to maintain compatibility
Divergence in development practices between communities

scenarios.title: Scenario 3 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 3 is planning to migrate its popular IDE from a perpetual license model to a subscription-based model with cloud features. The current ecosystem includes:
list: Large base of free and paid plugins
Active community of extension developers
Strong presence in corporate environments
Integration with various third-party tools
Possible community resistance to change
Risk of losing plugin developers
Need to maintain compatibility with existing integrations
Competitors may take advantage of the transition to attract users

scenarios.title: Scenario 4 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 4 is an API platform that grew from 1,000 to 50,000 developers in 18 months. Its ecosystem includes:
list: SDKs for 12 different languages
Integration marketplace
Documentation in 4 languages
Technical ambassador program
Increasing response time in support
Outdated documentation in some languages
Inconsistencies between different SDKs
Difficulty in maintaining the quality of integrations in the marketplace
Overload on technical ambassadors

scenarios.title: Scenario 5 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 5 has maintained a popular front-end framework for 8 years. Recently:
list: New web technologies have emerged strongly
Younger developers prefer more modern alternatives
Companies have started migrating to new frameworks
Key contributors have started leaving
There is still a large installed base
Many companies depend on the framework
There is a robust ecosystem of components and tools
The long-standing community is still active

scenarios.title: Scenario 6 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 6, a NoSQL database company, has seen explosive growth in emerging markets, especially Asia and Latin America. The current ecosystem is:
list: Predominantly in English
Centered in North American and European communities
Maintained by a primarily Western team
Language barriers in documentation and support
Different cultural expectations of community
Time zone complicating events and support
Different usage patterns by region
Need to adapt educational materials

scenarios.title: Scenario 7 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 7 is a microservices framework with high dependency on a few key developers for maintaining critical components. The current situation is:
list: Two of the main maintainers have left the project
Knowledge about critical parts of the architecture was centralized
Technical documentation is outdated
New contributors have difficulty taking on responsibilities
Issues are starting to pile up without resolution
The community expresses concern about the future of the framework

scenarios.title: Scenario 8 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 8 is a NoSQL database system that has been around for 10 years. The ecosystem shows:
list: Performance gradually degrading
Difficulty keeping up with modern security requirements
Growing incompatibility with new technologies
Architecture difficult to modify to meet new use cases
Competitors offering more modern and efficient solutions
User base starting to migrate to other solutions

scenarios.title: Scenario 9 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 9 is a front-end development framework showing the following signs:
list: Decrease in response rate on Stack Overflow
Reduction in the number of new contributors
Drop in the frequency of commits and pull requests
Increase in the average time to resolve issues
Low participation in community events
Decrease in the creation of educational content by the community

scenarios.title: Scenario 10 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 10 is a cloud computing platform facing the following situation:
list: Discovery of multiple critical vulnerabilities
Significant delays in security updates
Loss of important security certifications
Migration of corporate clients to competitors
Decrease in community trust after incidents
Difficulty maintaining compliance with new regulations

scenarios.title: Scenario 11 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 11 is a mobile app development platform presenting the following scenario:
list: Unilateral decisions by the central organization causing dissatisfaction in the community
Lack of transparency in roadmap changes
Conflicts between commercial objectives and community needs
Inconsistency in governance policies
Delays in approving community contributions
Poor communication about feature deprecations
Increase in public complaints from developers

scenarios.title: Scenario 12 (of 15):
scenarios.text: Company 12 is an AI development platform facing:
list: Rising infrastructure and maintenance costs
Difficulty monetizing premium services
Competitors offering free alternatives
Decrease in financial support from sponsors
Increase in regulatory compliance costs
Limited resources for development
Drop in the number of enterprise customers

scenarios.title: Scenario 13 (of 15):
scenarios.text: An open-source software development platform seeks to improve the quality and maintainability of its codebase. The challenges encountered are:
list: Exponential growth of lines of code
Increase in project complexity
Need to reduce technical debt
Maintaining code quality
Efficient management of bugs and commits

scenarios.title: Scenario 14 (of 15):
scenarios.text: A technology startup seeks to optimize collaboration between globally distributed teams. The challenges are:
list: Coordination between teams in different time zones
Maximizing collaborative productivity
Creating value through collaboration
Efficient release management
Optimization of network resources

scenarios.title: Scenario 15 (of 15):
scenarios.text: An open-source software ecosystem seeks to ensure its long-term relevance and adaptability. The challenges include:
list: Maintaining technological independence
Ensuring compatibility between components
Ensuring long-term sustainability
Managing node and interconnection metrics
Adapting to technological changes without losing identity
